instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No PPBUS 5V
threads.message:
MB with no water damage, just stop work.
Here is some measurements and i hope you guys can give me some direction.

No short to ground on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 


Diode Mode (red prob to ground)

------- <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> Powerline
<CAPACITOR>C3200</CAPACITOR> = 0.376

J3300
5.20V (Power Meter) On and OFF

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 0
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> = 3.4V goes to 3.3V after a two second and stay in loop

Thank you

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No PPBUS 5V
threads.message:
"CB305 = 0.071"
Bad UB300, if the cap is good...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No PPBUS 5V
threads.message:
I replaced UB300 and i got 0.453
However, still doing the same thing:
J3300
5.20V (Power Meter) On and OFF

JB500
5.20V (Power Meter) Static
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 0
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> = 3.4V goes to 3.3V after a two second and stay in loop

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No PPBUS 5V
threads.message:
Did you solder exact same chip code?
You probably have another bad <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP>, or maybe bad solders on the changed one.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No PPBUS 5V
threads.message:
Yes.
What about the <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> and <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>? Do you think the problem is just one ?
What else can i look to make sure that is the real problem?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No PPBUS 5V
threads.message:
You must be sure all chips are good and properly soldered.
If the problem is on the main power suplly, or some secondary supply, then all USB-C ports should have the same behaviour.
If you get one port with different symptom, that should point to an issue on the USB-C circuitry.
